full_text: Page 2832 MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-H DATE: 08/07/2019 TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE 12:00-12:30 AM 1213 1244 (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) 8:00-8:30 AM 813 814 4:00-4:30 PM 12:30- 1:00 AM 1242 1243 8:30- 9:00 AM 845 846 4:30-5:00 PM 1:00-1:30 AM 119 120 9:00-9:30 AM 921 922 5:00 -5:30 PM 1:30-2:00 AM 141 142 9:30-10:00 AM 953 954 5:30-6:00 PM 2:00-2:30 AM 202 203 10:00-10:30 AM 1024 1025 6:00-6:30 PM 2:30-3:00 AM 232 233 10:30-11:00 AM 1055 1056 6:30-7:00 PM 3:00-3:30 AM 304 305 11:00-11:30 AM 1127 1128 7:00-7:30 PM 3:30-4:00 AM 331 332 11:30-12:00 AM 1149 1150 7:30-8:00 PM 4:00-4:30 AM 410 411 12:00-12:30 PM 1223 1224 8:00-8:30 PM 4:30-5:00 AM 432 433 12:30- 1:00 PM 1255 1256 8:30- 9:00 PM 5:00 -5:30 AM 504 505 1:00-1:30 PM 130 131 9:00-9:30 PM 5:30-6:00 AM 534 535 1:30-2:00 PM 145 146 9:30-10:00 PM 6:00-6:30 AM 610 611 2:00-2:30 PM 222 223 10:00-10:30 PM 6:30-7:00 AM 634 635 2:30-3:00 PM 253 254 10:30-11:00 PM 7:00-7:30 AM 708 709 3:00-3:30 PM 325 326 11:00-11:30 PM 7:30-8:00 AM 736 737 3:30-4:00 PM 353 354 11:30-12:00 PM MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN DOJ-OGR-00026488

text_blocks.content: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-H DATE: 08/07/2019

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT
